title: Dealing With Unexpected Data in JavaScript (English Version)
description: In this article we discuss how we can deal with nulls and undefineds in JavaScript, if are there best practices and, if so, what are them.

title: Dealing with Unexpected Data in JavaScript
description: In this article we discuss how we can deal with nulls and undefineds in JavaScript, if are there best practices and, if so, what are them.

title: Why Your Data Relations Matter
description: In this meetup I explain what are graph databases and how to use them the best way

title: JavaScript in 2020: What to expect
description: In this article we talk about all the features JS has to offer us in this 2020.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #6 - The Old V8 (Portuguese Edition)
description: In this article of the series we talk about how V8 used to use Crankshaft and other compilers to compile JavaScript code!

title: Node.js Under The Hood #7 - The new V8
description: In this article of the series we explore more about Turbofan, Ignition, bytecodes and the new V8 compiling pipeline

title: Optional Chaining & Nullish Coalescence Operators in TypeScript
description: In this article we'll discuss the new implementations for the next step of ECMAScript and how we can apply them on TS right now.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #6 - The Old V8
description: In this article of the series, we talk about the old compiler pipeline v8 used to have before TurboFan and Ignition.

title: Café Debug #34 - Manda Nodejs!
description: In this funny podcast we talk about Node.js in all its forms, what it is, how it came to be and what it does to us!

title: DevFest Galway - Dynamic Testing Environments Using Helm and Kubernetes
description: In this presentation I show how we can leverage Helm and Kubernetes to create dynamic testing environments.

title: Applying Kubernetes to Node.js Microservices
description: In this talk I took the project made by another speaker and together, me and the crowd, tried to move it to Kubernetes. We applied all configurations, understood what Kubernetes is and how it works.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #5 - Hidden Classes and Variable Allocation
description: In this article we discuss how V8 engine takes a dynamic language such as JavaScript and runs it on a static compiler.

title: Scaling Node.js Applications With Kubernetes
description: In this talk we explore what Kubernetes is, how it came to be, how is our current workflow without it and how we can upgrade our pipeline by using Kubernetes do scale and manage our containers

title: Scaling JavaScript applications with Kubernetes
description: In this talk I explain what Kubernetes is and how we can use it fully to scale our applications

title: GDG Manaus: The Dark Side Of JavaScript
description: In this talk we discuss about APIs JavaScript had for a long long time but no one actually knew what they were or how to use them.

title: Career talks for technical students in São Paulo
description: I was grateful to be selected to be one of the speakers at ETEC Embu, during their technical week where I could talk about career, a bit of my story, how I got here, funny but memorable stories and tips for those who want to eventually become a developer.

title: Dissecting Node.js to the bone
description: In this talk I go through all the aspects of Node.js from the highest level code to the bare bone of V8. We talk about compiling pipelines, bytecodes, call stack and frames, event loop and a lot of other stuff so people can not only use node, but completely understand it.

title: The Future of Promises in JavaScript
description: In this article I'll be talking about how the Promises ecosystem is evolving and how the new proposals are making it awesome!

title: Node.js Under The Hood #4 - Let's Talk About V8
description: In this article we continue to explain Node.js Under The Hood by talking topics. In this particular topic we cover part of how V8 works and ASTs

title: Node.js under the hood #3 - Deep Dive into the event loop (portuguese version)
description: In this portuguese version of this article, we'll deep dive into the Node.js event loop and understand how ticks work

title: Kubernetes: An introduction to container management
description: In this webinar I talk about what is Kubernetes, how it works, what it can do and how we can take the most of it when creating our container infrastructure

title: #NoSQLBR 2019 - Why your data relations matter?
description: In this particular talk I gave at NoSQL BR we talked about graph databases and how they can be a life changing experience both the way we create databases and manage our data but also on how we extract intelligence from this data.

title: Why your data relations matter?
description: In this particular talk I gave at Mackenzie University we talked about graph databases and how they can be a life changing experience both the way we create databases and manage our data but also on how we extract intelligence from this data.

title: GraphQL: A new way to build APIs
description: In this talk I explain the concept behind GraphQL, its origins and how we can take the most of it

title: Dissecting Node.js
description: In this talk I deep dive into the architectural aspects of Node.js and show how it works. We dive into the event loop, callback queues, call stack and V8

title: The dark side of JavaScript
description: In this talk we explore several unknown (or not so famous) JavaScript APIs for doing awesome things like Reflection, Async Iterators and more

title: The dark side of JavaScript
description: In this talk I present several new ways to do usual things in JS using unusual APIs. We talked about Reflection, Bitwise operators and more

title: Understanding messaging patterns with microservices
description: In this talk I gave to a class of university students, we explored the origin of MoA, messaging patterns and messaging protocols and several use cases.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #2 - Understanding JavaScript (Portuguese edition)
description: In this translation of my last article in this series, we discuss about how the V8 engine runs JavaScript and how the call stack works.

title: ABCDev 2019
description: ABCDev is the biggest technology event in the ABC region of São Paulo. In this event we talk about several topics, there's no limit to topics and we had 26 presentations in the course of two tracks along with a track fully dedicated to workshops. It's an annual event held in the ABC region, one of São Paulo's main residential areas. It's also one of the most diverse events in the country, we received 450 confirmed tickets and 322 people at once, about 40% of the event's attendees were part of underrepresented groups and they gave us the feedback that they felt welcome to talk about anything and any problem they were through. Besides, our speakers are always divided into 50% representation, so we had 26 talks in total, 13 of them of males and 13 of females (not to mention the gender representativity). This is by far the most inclusive event in the state.

title: Kubernetes - Giving your infrastructure superpowers!
description: In this talk we discuss what Kubernetes is, how does it work, how can we use it along with a hands of example of how to spin up your own infrastructure, scale it and delete it in less than 5 minutes

title: Using Worker Threads in Node.js
description: Recently the Worker Threads API was marked stable for Node.js. This means we can now use async parallel processing in a stable fashion. We'll exemplify creating a simple blockchain miner.

title: Kubernetes - Giving your infrastructure superpowers!
description: In this talk we discuss what Kubernetes is, how does it work, how can we use it and in this particular meetup we discussed how we could use Kubernetes along with AI and ML.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #2 - Understanding JavaScript
description: In this second article of the series, we discuss deeper how Node.js works under the hood starting by its most high level component: The JavaScript

title: Node.js Under The Hood #1 - Getting to know our tools (Portuguese Edition)
description: In this series of articles I talk about the internals of Node.js and how we can better understand what is going on under the hood.

title: Node.js Under The Hood #1 - Getting to know our tools
description: In this series of articles I talk about the internals of Node.js and how we can better understand what is going on under the hood.

title: TypeScriptBR #1 - Pilot
description: In this first meetup for the first ever Brazilian community fully focused on TypeScript we had the incredible presence of Orta Therox, one of the TS developers, answering some questions and sharing his knowledge with us. Along with 3 incredible talks about TS fundamentals, and advanced types.

title: Kubernetes - An introduction to container management
description: This book is fully aimed to beginners and intermediate developers/devops who want to know more about network and infrastructure. In this book I go from the zero to hero on being a complete master in Kubernetes.

title: ESNext: GlobalThis and all you need to know about it
description: In this article we'll explore all the aspects of the newest GlobalThis proposal for Javascript

title: Creating a Promise from Scratch
description: In this article we'll continue to learn about asynchronous flux in JavaScript by creating a simple Promise implementation from scratch, following the Promises/A+ implementation in Typescript

title: Dissecting Node.js - Understanding the most popular JS runtime to the bone
description: In this presentation I go deep inside Node.js, talking about not only how Node works but also how JavaScript, V8, Libuv and all other dependencies work together to create this awesome environment we have.

title: Node.js Crypto - Securing applications natively
description: In this talk I present not only the concept of cryptography, but also how it evolved over the years, how cryptographic algorithms work and how we can implement heavy security without installing a single module

title: Controlling time with event sourcing and Typescript
description: In this talk I present the concept of Event Sourcing, how can we use it, how can it be useful and how can you do it by yourself!

title: Understanding Async Iterators
description: In this article I explain what are async iterators and how we can use their power to make promise chaining and promise loops more easily readable.

title: Using Helm and Kubernetes to Create Dynamic Testing Environments
description: In this presentation for the São Paulo chapter of the Docker meetups, I introduce both Helm and Kubernetes along with CI tools in order to generate complete testing environments which are entirely dynamic. Along with a demo on how I did it and how others can also do it

title: Applying Event Sourcing to Typescript projects using NodeJS and DDD
description: In this presentation I tell people how we implemented a real use case of Event Sourcing with Typescript and DDD in a huge plastic industry as well as concepts of: What is Event Sourcing, why Typescript, why DDD, the perks of MVC along with DDD and the perks of a layered architecture in Node.js

title: Giving your data superpowers using graphs and Neo4J
description: Have you ever considered to use or to think differently than the current relational databases? In this article I present a "new" way of thinking data, using graphs you can have both speed, flexibility and intelligence using Neo4J and native graph databases with graph algorithms

title: Serverless Week
description: A full week of online activities around the serverless architecture with awesome professionals. This event will also gather donations for social communities.

title: Creating Dynamic Testing Environments Using Helm and Kubernetes
description: In this talk I present a way to separate your whole development structure by creating multiple complete environments which you can use for QA testing in a totally automated fashion using Helm and Kubernetes along with any CI

title: Web Workers and Service Workers
description: In this presentation I talk about what is a web and a service worker, their types, uses and show code snippets anyone can implement in order to achieve complete control over caching, parallel processing and a lot of other applications

title: Auditing applications with event sourcing and Typescript
description: In this particular talk I present the concepts of event sourcingand demo how we can use it along with typescript and VSCode to not only improve our code quality and efficiency but also to log and audit events in our entities

title: Applying Event Sourcing in a Node.js application
description: In this talk I present techniques of how we can create a full application using event sourcing architecture and Node.js with Typescript

title: Why your data relationships matter?
description: In this talk I present the concept of graph databases and how we can use, create and maintain our own graph model without hassle. Along with it and a simple example using Twitter data, we can extract a lot of intelligence using graph theory and graph algorithms

title: Understanding serverless in the serverless way
description: In this talk I explain what is serverless, pros, cons and all the opportunities we have when using this architecture

title: Nodeschool São Paulo #1
description: NodeSchool São Paulo is a monthly meetup dedicated to helping people learn JavaScript. We help people of all skill levels–from beginners to experts–discover what's possible with JavaScript. URL for the first event: https://www.meetup.com/nodeschoolsp/events/261811632/

title: Decentralized Identity Using Sovrin - Part 3
description: In this last part of the series, we deep dive into the last remaining concepts of sovrin.

title: Messaging with Microservices
description: In this presentation I introduce the whole concept of message oriented architecture, service bus, RPC, QoS and other core concepts of messaging. Along with definitions of broker, exchange, and how we can use it all with microservice architectures

title: Understanding Serverless
description: In this video and podcast we discuss what is serverless, use cases and how you can create your own functions. Link to podcast: https://anchor.fm/ouniversodaprogramacao/episodes/4-Desmistificando-Serverless-com-Igor-Halfeld-e-Lucas-Santos-e4dg8n

title: Auditing your application with event sourcing e Typescript: VS Summit 2019
description: In this talk we discuss about what is Event Sourcing and how we can use the power of Typescript to take the most of this pattern.

title: Building Dynamic Environments with Helm, Kubernetes and DevOps
description: In this talk we explore the limits of testing environments. Imagine how awesome would it be to have your own testing environment so you can test your features without messing with other people's code. This is the power Kubernetes gives you alongside Helm and Azure DevOps.

title: The dark side of Javascript
description: In this talk we explore a bit more about the hidden functions of the Javascript language. Most people are so used to search and copy solutions from common problems directly from the web they forget Javascript has an awesome set of features.

title: Decentralized Identity with Sovrin - part 2
description: In this article, I talk about how we can implement and use a decentralized framework called Sovrin to implement digital identity in a secure and easy fashion

title: Podtag - Serverless
description: In this podcast we discuss what is serverless, how can it apply to your applications and best practices using functions. Along with some funny real stories.

title: NodeBR #51 - Javascript vs Typescript
description: A whole event focused on discussing the differences and how Typescript can make developers' life much easier. We also held a discussion group in the end with all the members. This event also held an official NodeJS user feedback session which was sent directly to the NodeJS Foundation.

title: Scalable cloud-based applications with AKS
description: In this meetup I talk about how we can create scalable cloud-based applications using the power of NodeJS with AKS. Also explaining some of the newest functionalities such as virtual nodes and auto scaling

title: Decentralized Digital Identity with Sovrin
description: In this series of posts we will talk about how we can implement and understand core concepts of Sovrin, a blockchain-based solution to decentralize and give the power of identity back to people.

title: Controling time with Typescript and Event Sourcing
description: In this talk I spoke about how we can take advantage of types and all the power Typescript offers us to apply the concept and implementation of the event sourcing architecture to control events in a real world project.

title: Qual é o salário de um desenvolvedor?

title: Qualidade além do código: Indo além da tela
description: Nesta série de artigos vamos falar sobre como podemos aumentar a nossa capacidade de entrega e qualidade sem tocar um dedo no nosso código. Nesta primeira parte falamos sobre times e interação entre pessoas.

title: Tardis - An Event Sourcing framework built with Typescript
description: Tardis is an implementation library built to aid in the event sourcing architecture. At first, it was created to serve internal purposes and then published so the community could take advantage of the marvels Typescript can do using Event Sourcing.

title: TC Talks #9
description: Meetup do Training Center, com a intenção de criar um ambiente para network e para os participantes (ou não) da nossa comunidade terem a oportunidade de se encontrar. Não conhece o Training Center ainda? Acesse nosso site: https://trainingcenter.io/ Quer enviar uma proposta de palestra? 19:30 - apresentação de 10 minutos. 19:40 - Talk 1 de 30 minutos 20:10 - 20 minutos de coffee 20:30 - Talk 2 de 30 minutos Depois abre pra happy e networking. Entrada: A apresentação do DOCUMENTO é OBRIGATÓRIA para a participação, informe no momento do cadastro no evento. Observação: Para participar do evento e palestrar leia nosso Código de Conduta (https://github.com/training-center/sobre/blob/master/CONDUCT.md) e esteja de acordo para que possamos proporcionar uma ambiente agradável para todos. APRESENTAÇÕES Talk 1 "Usabilidade em Aplicações Móveis" com Ingrid Mendes (https://twitter.com/_didingrid) Irei apresentar o conceito de Usabilidade da literatura técnica, junto com um modelo voltado para verificar a Usabilidade em Aplicações Móveis, contemplando os desafios inerentes à esse tipo de aplicação. Talk 2 "Ícones - por que se importar?" com Rachel Pardo (https://dribbble.com/shel) Da construção consistente de uma iconografia à validação com usuário.

title: Utilizando AVA para testar seu código
description: Neste artigo mostro como podemos tirar proveito do AVA, um test runner assíncrono, na hora de testar nosso código javascript/typescript
